page.title: 15WEBSCOTT FARM, CROPS.
page.content: At Webscott they have 220 acres of silage and grazing land and 60 acres of corn.Most of the land is used for silage.The silage is usually cut around May and early June.They cut the corn in late August they have 2 barns to store the bales in.It is not a very big {FARM }really.After silaging they fertilise where they silaged they store the silage under a big polythene sheet with tyres on to stop it blowing away. Mostly up at the {FARM}when they fertilise they get bags of fertiliser and put it in the machine on the back of the tractor.When they get the corn in they {WORK}till 10:oopm. They have got a lane with grazing land down the side.
